You lose weight because your appetite goes away and you are indeed anorexic. I couldn't sleep, had extreme anxiety, headaches, dry mouth, highs and lows....I can go on and on. It changes you and you may think it's great but ultimately you lose yourself in the process.

Concerta (methylphenidate): I'm 56 years old, and I was diagnosed with moderate to severe ADD when I was in my 30s. Then, in June of 2009, corporate shut down the location where I worked and laid off nearly everyone, including me. There were no jobs available, so I decided to go back to school and get a second degree. This is where I discovered that I had nowhere near the focus that I needed to pull of 14 credits per semester. My doctor prescribed Concerta, which really helped a lot, as long as it was before 1:00 PM. He recently upped the dosage to 54 mg. Now, I can even handle the late-night homework sessions. It's been a lifesaver for me.

Concerta (methylphenidate): I dont know how I feel about it. I'm 21, I was diagnosed with adhd this summer. My grades went from c's and b's to A's and deans list. Concerta (methylphenidate): I have been using Concerta for about 3 weeks now and it has changed my life drastically. Concerta (methylphenidate): I'm a 15 year old girl and have been taking 18 mg in the morning for 4 days now and 0.1mg of clonidine at night. Daytrana (methylphenidate): I am a 22 yr old female. Hated the significant side effects of Vyvase60mg. Hated Invuniv. Love the patch. Allows me to control the medication. I realized I cannot blow dry my hair, or go tanning with it on or I would get a big burst of medication! Sometimes have a hard time sleeping if I don't take it off early!

Concerta (methylphenidate): My son had been on Strattera for about 2 months and, when we increased his dosage to 60 mg, he became angry, hostile and belligerent. I'm anxious to see how he does in the next few weeks, but I appreciate hearing the positive results others have posted. We've tried everything up to this point and I am hopeful.
Methylin (methylphenidate): I have only been on it for one month. It's the best thing I have taken.

Concerta (methylphenidate): For me, who is about to be 40 years old, I found that I had a shorter fuse than normal, couldn't finish anything, no energy, no focus. Went in to talk with a doctor and he tested me and found that I too was ADHD. I cannot tell you that I was shocked. He said it was bad enough to warrant 36mg starting point. I started it on a Thursday and by Sunday I had lost 6 lbs already. Not that I didn't like losing that much but not the way it happened. I have been so nauseated. Now, days are not too bad but I feel like I am crashing at night and also very nauseated at night still. I cannot take this anymore. I will actually go back to the way I was, before I will keep up with this. For my son at 81mg a day. It is absolutely FANTASTIC for him.

Daytrana (methylphenidate): Oldest son (now 11 1/2) known to us (and teachers) to have ADHD by 5 yrs of age. Did not want him on medicines, but by 2nd grade, he was not able to work to his potential. Tried Focalin. Made my sweet, funny child nauseous and zombie like. We both cried every morning while he took it. Tried for 2 months, said forget it, not worth it. Concerta (methylphenidate): I'm quite depressed and bad at schoolwork. When I take Concerta especially high doses, I do much better at school and my depression goes away. I also lost 10 pounds in a month going from 105 to 95 it's kinda cool being this skinny, my friends think I'm anorexic but I'm just not hungry.

Ritalin (methylphenidate): Works very well in the begining. After a couple of months induces tolerance. Anyway, it changed my professional and personal lifestyles. Now I pity of the person I was. I never experienced a linear and practical thought until I used this.
Concerta (methylphenidate): Very bad side effect: insomnia, depression, important weight lost...

Ritalin (methylphenidate): I have 9 yr old twins who have ADHD. They've been on Concerta we are up to 36 mg and it was doing nothing. Ritalin (methylphenidate): but makes me feel dizzy.

Concerta (methylphenidate): This medication has made a huge improvement for my son. He is doing better in school and has NO SIDE EFFECTS, which is a major plus to me. No mood swings, fits of rage, or emotional melt downs. I would recommend trying this medication to anyone.

Daytrana (methylphenidate): My teenager daughter was recently diagnosed with ADHD to no surprise to anyone. She managed well until high school and was then put on Daytrana. she has experienced no side effects except decrease in appetite and if she keeps the patch on too long she might have difficulty falling asleep. Overall she does not seem to have the rebound issues that people have with the medications taken by mouth.

Concerta (methylphenidate): I've been taking Concerta for about 8 years and it's helped my mood and productivity a lot. The first day off it isn't bad, but after that I get really cranky. So I like myself a lot better on it than off! My wife does too. It's not a miracle, but it definitely helps.
Take in the morning before breakfast. Take any other medications after breakfast. Works best for me this way.

Metadate CD (methylphenidate): 7 year old with ADHD, with the HD prevailing. Started 10 mg Metadate CD in the morning and teacher reported night and day difference, but late in the day was night marish. Grouchy, no focus and constantly arguing. Doctor decided that it metabolized quickly and was out of his system too quickly. Started 20 mg in the morning and saw immediate improvement in the afternoons. BUT...vocal and motor tics began, up to 7-10 a minute, and we stopped it right away. Started 0.25 mg Guanfacine to relax the system, up to 3 mg now. Tics have lessened, but still present daily. I have 2 boys on AdderallXR now.  They have been on generic Ritalin, Concerta, Metadate CD, all for ADHD.  My oldest is 15 and has been on stimulant medicines since 8 years old.  All in all the stimulants work for both boys academically.  Sort of helps in socializing.  They will stay on medication until out of college and hopefully be able to handle stress and life on their own.  The main problems with stimulants are side effects, blurred vision, headaches, a lot of stomach aches, whinnying, fussing and can not sleep at night. Is it worth it? I am concerned for their well being.  But not focusing is harder on them, they would always be behind in everything.  Parents have to deal with what is the best solution for their child, with us it is medicines.

Works like a charm.  It has significantly helped me with concentration- whether sitting in a lecture or retaining my train of thought, restlessness, and some impulsiveness.  One thing- for me, mixing with caffeine is a no-no, as it makes me jittery and shaky.  But I can do a half-caf coffee. Around 1 am though, I get pretty restless.
Concerta (methylphenidate): Made me very itchy and gave me liver dysfunction, doctor says it was a very rare side affect

Methylin (methylphenidate): This drug has changed my life. I have ADD and depression. I used to not be able to get out of bed for a week at a time. Concerta (methylphenidate): I was diagnosed a few months ago (I'm 19) with ADD. The first--any only-- medicine I have tried thus far is Concerta (27 and 36mg). Concerta (methylphenidate): Started Concerta 5 weeks ago. Started with a pediatric dose (I'm almost 40) and worked up to 54mg. Metadate CD (methylphenidate): I was diagnosed with ADD when I was 11 and have been on this medicine for 8 years now. It helped me focus on school and work. When I first started I lost weight but Im pretty sure its because I did not eat before taking my pills. Metadate has truly helped me out.

Daytrana (methylphenidate): This is our second month on Daytrana for my 5 year old, who used to have many problems in school: getting into trouble, not sitting, hitting other kids, etc... Ritalin (methylphenidate): Ritali doesn't work for me but Concerta does. My dosage is 72 mg of Concerta. 200 mg of Seroquel and 20 mg of Ritalin.

Ritalin (methylphenidate): I'm a 40 year old male who didn't have the benefits of medications when I was in school. ADD wasn't as well known back then. I was diagnosed with hyper dyslexia. Methylin ER (methylphenidate): My adult ADHD is the result of a traumatic brain injury. This has been helpful with the ADHD, but also with other symptoms from the TBI.

Ritalin (methylphenidate): I felt very groggy and out of it for while on this drug, I felt like I could barely form a thought and had great difficulty interacting with people while on it. I had no feelings, no emotions it felt like if I had to choose an emotion it would be disoriented.

Daytrana (methylphenidate): Used this for recently diagnosed adult ADD (no hyper-activity). What a difference it made. Started at 30mg, finished at 40mg (30mg plus 10mg patch). Daytrana (methylphenidate): This patch was not very useful to me. All it did was irritate my skin and cause a huge loss in appetite. While on this, however, I lost no weight.

Ritalin (methylphenidate): For years I had been battling behavior problems with my son who is now 10. Metadate CD (methylphenidate): My son is 7 and has been on this medicine for a year now. We tried everything before putting him on medicine. We started out with 10mg and really saw no effect. Concerta (methylphenidate): My dosage is 27 mg and I take it in the morning before I go to school. It tends to ware off by 12.

Metadate CD (methylphenidate): Our son has gone through 3 other medicines, and this is the only one that has worked with no side effects. Concerta (methylphenidate): My son is 10 years old. Concerta (methylphenidate): My son was prescribed the drug just before summer. It worked great at the beginning but now since school has started the drug is not working. Concerta (methylphenidate): As an adult with ADHD Concerta is the way to go. Focused and able to complete tasks. Although the lack of appetite and sleep come into play the time released 18mg work better for me then the 27mg...With 27 mgs I was tired and moody.

Concerta (methylphenidate): This medication really, really helps me with everything.

Concerta (methylphenidate): This is the best medicine my son has ever been on. He has done great in school. A's and B's all year.
